messages.message:
I'll ask my question here for now! But I would find it really useful if someone wants to spearhead a channel for python/go questions in the future :slightly_smiling_face:

In manage_apps_server.py, I am using request.is_json (https://tedboy.github.io/flask/generated/generated/flask.Request.is_json.html). Mypy is giving me this error: `"IBRequest" has no attribute "is_json"`. It seems to be working in the code, and I don't see anything in the special IBRequest type (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/src/py/stubs/flask/globals.pyi#L10) that extends Request that would make this not work. Any ideas how to fix this?
I’ve run into something similar before and had to update the typing for `IBRequest` (PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/53045) for reference)
Not sure why we use `IBRequest` because it does seem to be just an incomplete wrapper of `flask.Request`

Yup basically as William said, i think we generally add typing as we add new methods/fields when we use them. (We don’t have complete mypy types and keep them up to sync with the latest library versions and such). So whenever you introduce a new one, you’ll need to go update/add the mypy stubs for it.
Okay got it, thank you both!! Here I am used to Typescript :zany_face:
